contentrichtext.text: '''Kamel Mubdir al-Kilani''' ({{lang-ar|كامل مبدر الكيلاني}})(born 1958) was Finance Minister in the cabinet appointed by the [[Interim Iraq Governing Council]] in September 2003. A [[Sunni]] Muslim and contractor, al-Kilani remained in Iraq during the span of the [[Saddam Hussein]] government. He holds a diploma degree in economics and public administration from [[Mustansariyah University]] in [[Baghdad]]. ==References== * {{cite web| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3199561.stm| title=Iraq's post-war cabinet| accessdate=2006-02-24| author=BBC News| year=2003 | date=2003-09-01}} {{start box}} {{succession box | title=Finance Minister| before=[[Coalition Provisional Authority]]| years= September 2003–June 2004| after=[[Adil Abdel-Mahdi]] }} {{end box}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Kilani, Kamel | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1958 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kilani, Kamel}} [[Category:Government ministers of Iraq]] [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Iraqi people of Iranian descent]] {{Iraq-politician-stub}}
